abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment reviews
            the Agricultural Development Project's potential
            environmental adversity, and, although it concludes that
            project impacts are generally positive, adequate management,
            and low-cost mitigation should minimize negative effects.
            The main environmental concerns are: natural resource
            management, which in addition to forest degradation, and the
            concomitant problems of flooding, - lower dry season flows,
            and siltation - biodiversity may well be affected by
            ecological disturbances in the Mekong River system; direct
            impacts on project areas, such as the effects on soil
            quality, and salinity risks, drainage impacts on
            sedimentation, surface water, and water-logging, site
            contamination due to residues, and oil spills from
            construction works, and/or toxic chemical residues entering
            the soil, surface and groundwater; and, impacts on health,
            caused by increased disease vectors, and the incidence of
            malaria and other diseases. Mitigation calls for: 1)
            technical training to incorporate uplands conservation,
            fisheries, and wetlands management; 2) development of
            management guidelines to control saline soils, and
            groundwater; 3) contract specifications, to contain worker
            safety, site restoration, waste disposal, environmental
            standards, and be subjected to inspections; and, 4)
            community training, information, and education to be
            provided on health issues, with linkages to national health
            programs. The second volume, addresses development
            strategies for ethnic minorities, and vulnerable groups,
            though resettlement issues will be addressed in the Social Assessment.
